Reviews.Title: “Bug galore!!...cockroaches everywhere....not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Rajhunjan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as sold by the agent in uk as a 4 star rating.... Should have been a no star rating... Poor service and bugs and cockroaches in rooms, changed rooms but still the same....not nice....! Will never stay or recommend this Al Manar hotel

Reviews.Title: “Book in advance”
Reviews.Author: ambadkar
Reviews.Content: The management / owners are opportunists. I was massively overcharged as walk in guest. The entrance of the hotel is a bit disappointing, but once inside, it is Ok. The furniture is a bit worn out and needs repairs replacement. The microwave oven could not be used as the plug and socket were of different standards and so I could not heat my food! In spite of paying double amount for the room, breakfast was not included! I had to remind the manager about the amount he had charged me for the room before he relented for a free breakfast! The breakfast was not very elaborate but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “its comfortable (ish), but has issues”
Reviews.Author: kmelectric
Reviews.Content: Ok - I`ll start by saying the hotel isn`t "bad"......it just isn`t all that good, in my opinion. The first hurdle was finding the hotel - taxi driver didn`t have a clue, and had to phone a few people to find out where it was; even though we had the address written down, ready for him. Not the most auspicious start, really. The hotel is situated midway along a sidestreet - there are plenty of local shops, supermarkets, metro station etc. all within easy walking distance. We`d just disembarked a cruise; it was approx 10.00 a.m. when we arrived. We fully expected that the room wouldn`t be ready, but we wanted to drop the luggage off, then go explore for a while. So we were somewhat surprised to be told our room (117) was ready! Wow, that`s a promising start. Sure enough, the room was ready - clean enough, little kitchen with all you need for a few days (except the food). The only "problem" was that we couldn`t get into the room with our keycard - we had to get maintenance to let us in for the first two days....apparently the keycard machine broke down! The hotel had a ready answer for this......we were moved next door, into 116. So, now we get to the things you "need to know" regarding the rooms: 1. All the electrical equipment supplied in both our rooms was 2 pin, european plugs. 2. All the sockets in the room were british 3 pin. You need an adaptor, but probably the exact opposite of the ones you normally take! 3. There were bedside lights on the tables; but, in room 116, there isn`t a socket within reach of one side off the bed - and the other side is a bit of a stretch to the nearest socket. 4. The supplied kettle was leaking onto the base - took it to the maintenance guy, who apparently "mended" it ......by making it leak more than it did to start with. After a bit more arguing with the young girl at reception (who we`ll get back to later), another kettle was provided. 5. The "double room", as is often the case, is 2 single beds pushed together. What surprised me was they were individually made; i.e. as 2 single beds. 6. The "view". This is probably the worst issue, aesthetically speaking. The windows have, in all likelihood, never been cleaned. You`ll need to open the window, to know whether its light or dark outside; and all we could see was the back of an equally dirty building, 6 metres away across an alley. ***** The "restaurant"***** We (luckily) chose not to eat there the first night. The hotel don`t have their own kitchens - the food is carried across the alley from the indian restaurant next door (breakfast, lunch and evening meal). Apparently, the first night was a very poor choice of 3 "things", unidentified, which were supposed to be served hot, but weren`t. By way of apology, the management offered a free transfer to Mamzar beach the next day. The breakfasts weren`t bad (but I usually only have cereal, toast and coffee - difficult to mess up). There were "hot" options, which changed daily - all I can say is they looked nice enough. Reception - specifically staff attitudes. We saw three reception staff during our stay. The young girl mentioned above, a youngish guy and an older man. The young man was pleasant, polite, helpful, friendly. The older man was "alright"; but the young girl. I`m not sure what to say, to be honest, other than "avoid if at all possible". There is a rooftop pool. But there is limited sunbed space; a wall so high you can hardly see any of the view; and it was closed off for most of our stay. Would I return to this hotel? Not if I had a choice. I`d have given it two and a half stars perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel AlManar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this Hotel and I would not rate it anymore than a two star hotel,we stayed in the Arbain Park Hotel which was a 3 star hotel on 18th December 2011 and it was certainly of a higher standard than the Al Manar. The standard of food for british people was not acceptable and generaly no checks had been done prior to you moving into the room,my son had three different room before he managed to get a hot shower .If you want to enjoy your holiday do not book Faulty Towers which is a correct description for this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Useful Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peperi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find as the taxi driver was uncertain of locations within Dubai ( as usual in Dubai!!). Once there we were dealt with efficiently and politely. The room was clean and neat. We used the hotel as a transit stop and found its location convenient for access to the airport. The area around the hotel is not well provided for if one wants to do some shopping but using the metro and taxis make up for that. The restaurant is good, with efficient service and menu. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Rooms”
Reviews.Author: njamil
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well furnished and relaxing It was nice to stay there as all staff were welcoming and helpful Liked it a lot

Reviews.Title: “ok,no plan to use the hotel again”
Reviews.Author: bollyB2
Reviews.Content: Got given a room despite coming in well before the check in time,room was dirty,changed on request when the cleaner couldn't bring it up to scatch. Checked into another room which had to be cleaned on insistence. The staff were very helpful,willing to help but just can't get the cleaning right.Sajim at reception was particularly helpful and Santos was very friendly and likeable. A professional needs to go in the hotel and sort the cleaners out. My only complain is the cleaning standard,they even use the same cleaing mob for bathroom/toilet to clean all other rooms including kitchen. couldn't complain anymore. The cleaning standard is letting you down.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: samiragz
Reviews.Content: i went to Dubai in the middle of June for a one month holiday which ended in mid July and i stayed the whole time at Almanar the staff were just too nice just eager to please me and the area were all cleaned except at times at night when you hear some little noises here and there but otherwise ok, i'll recommend to my friends and would love to stay there again whenever i'm in Dubai the only minus is whenever i needed to go into Deira city centre the hold up on the way makes me stuck in traffic, but Almanar is really a good place with pleasant staff though the internet price is quite exorbitant

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality,highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: jojosebastian
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife with two kids under the age of five went a trip to India from Newcastle(UK) airport and stayed 3 days in Dubai Almonar hotel.We were first ime in Dubai and we don't have any friends around.We met the night incharge Mr.Santhosh at the hotel reception and he has arranged all the facilities over there.We haven't had any poblems over there and the room and the facilities highly clean and kitchen was well equiped.He was veryhelpful to findout local shops,especially currency exchange etc and the best way to reach the nearest tourist spots.He was well knowledged and helpful to all these three days .We have enjoyed to stay all these three days and highly recommended to all our friends who lives in UK.We defenetly will go back to this hotel next time without thinking another one. Thanks to all the staff, especially Mr. Santhosh at the reception. Mr. J Sebastian

Reviews.Title: “Amazing accommodation in Dubai. "home sweet home"”
Reviews.Author: funktrip
Reviews.Content: it didn't felt like our first time in Dubai because staying in this hotel is quite great. looking it from outside is a lot different from what is inside. big spacious room providing all the things like you are just at home. upon check in there's an Indian guy who can't find our reservations but with the help of 1 filipina Chinese lady who seems so friendly in assisting us and knowing that the other staff is under her training so it is worth considering why it took so long for him to do the check in. the service is good, all staff are friendly, adequate buffet breakfast, facilities are great and the price is worth the stay. No Bedbugs for sure. location is just easy near to the airport and shopping malls. outside environment is accessible from pharmacy, hospital, restaurants, supermarkets and a lot more. definitely we will be coming back again and will recommend Almanar to all of my friends off to Dubai for some adventure like Desert Safari, Dhowcruise and middle east City tours.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: wallpaper66
Reviews.Content: What a shock when the taxi driver dropped us off . it looked like concrete jungle. But once inside our apartment was much better than expected,2 bedrooms 2 bathrooms large kitchen and large lounge .The whole place was very clean and breakfast was adequate. This was are first time to Dubai but this hotel would not put us off coming again .You need taxis to take you everywhere and a nice place to go for any english / irish people is the Irish village which is about £4.00 in a taxi really good english food .another place to go is The Karama but you must barter with them .

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Rozela
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good..i booked a studio appartment and it was very spacious..the service was very good except that on the day of departure we wanted someone to help with the luggages and no body was there!..restaurant is always closed and when you ask they tell "no no it's open" but the lights are alwayz dim and nobody is there! suitable for family, no "affairs" go around...INTERNET: you have to pay 25 DHS per hour and once u start using ur hour you have 24 hours to finish it otherwise it's gone...the reason behind this as they explained: "if we don't limit the time of usage then u could take 1 hour only and do only important operations on internet and we wont be able to make more money" @_@ ...Excellent for ppl on budget (Y) and i would definetly recommend for others

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Steve51864
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the Bed Bug issue that some one wrote about, but I did not find any. The one-bedroom suite was huge, and we booked it from asiatravel.com and got a great deal. The breakfast was great, but definitely not 5-star hotel buffet. There were some minor problems like the water won't drain from the living room bathroom's sink, or our bedroom light's remote control didn't work on the last day, (battery must have run out). We were out most of the day, so we never saw the pool or the gym. We rented a car from the airport, so the location was not a problem for us. I can see that if you don't have a car, this hotel would be challenging. The entrance was in fact inside the parking garage. The internet charge was expensive, 25 AED for one hour! That is like US$ 8 for an hour! We stopped by some internet cafe near the Dubai Musem to check our e-mails and check in for our return flight. For half an hour, the charge was only 2 AED... Other than that, I think this hotel is a great deal. The kitchen was huge, but we never used it. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Well we're having a great time!”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl97
Reviews.Content: 2 40+ female travellers, booked this holiday last minute as it was cheaper than goning to Spain,.At first we were weary as not sure how we would be accepted in an Islamic country. We were escorted to a ladies taxi at the airport we paid 15 dirhams which I dont think is expensive (£3) Bags placed on trolley whilst we went to reception< I had booked a one bedroom suite with 2 single beds, we were offered a king size bed I said that wasn't acceptable so straight away we were upgraded to a 2 bed 3 bathroom suite !! The apartment is clean although the walls could do with a lick of paint. We get taxi from outside hotel, we have never waited more than 2 minutes they are that frequent go to Deira city centre mall costs 12 -13 dirhams then have buffet breakfast at Colours just near entrance to mall for 18 dirhams. Big bus tours are well worth the money get on and get off when you want. going on dower cruice tonight and desert safari tomorrow Around the hotel loads of places to eat really cheap the sandwich shop accross the street is highly recommended as is the Indian restaurant next door, The chinese restaurant around the corner is fab we have not paid more than 80 dirhams for 3 courses for the 2 of us Expect to pay alot more at the Malls or new souks 20 dirhams for a smoothy. I am very impressed with Dubai It has to be one of the most friendly places on earth everyone including Arabs speak english all signs and announcements are in english and NO grafitti anywhere!!! I can honestly say to any female lone travellers come here you'l have a great time and speaking as I find Al Manar hotel is a very friendly place with a great gym and ok quite a small pool area but to be honest I haven't been in it as it's been toooooo hot 40+ degrees even at 10am

Reviews.Title: “good but not enough”
Reviews.Author: gregorexs
Reviews.Content: Basically the hotel is good: large appartments, fully equiped kitchen in every studio, etc. The breacfast is very simple with just a few dishes. The staff is not very supportive - for example we had a problem one night with some of our neighbours who made a midnight party. Even after a few signals to the reception desk they did nothing and it was unavalilable to sleep for us this night. Also we found a bed bugs one day but in fact the staff solve this problem quicly. The location of the hotel is not good at all - it is too far from the transport connections. Reccomend to find a hotel near to Deira City Center - you will have not a transport problem in this case as there are metro and bus stations as well as taxi stop.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly,unhelpful staff & very basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Jamal18
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were unhelpful and unfriendly. The standard of the room was not accurately reflected in the pictures on the website. The room was very basic with old shabby furniture. The bed was uncomfortable hard. The location is extremely far from all the tourist attractions. It was about 45 minutes on the bus to Gold Souk. A plus is that it had a washer dryer & 1 very helpful member of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 3 Star quality hotel - Convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: jcann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in March. It is difficult to find being down a side alley. None of the taxi drivers we used knew where it was. You are given a large suite. The bedroom and bathroom are large, comfortable and reasonably clean. I suggest you do not look too carefully in the lounge and kitchen areas as they are not as good. Same with the small pool area on the roof. There is no shade, limited sunbeds and no bar / cafe. A bloody band aid on the floor day one was still there day three. On the first morning we went for breakfast at 0930. Everything had run out and was not replaced. The second morning we arrived earlier and the breakfast was adequate. The hotel has no bar or restaurant. The coffee shop is suposedly 24 hours, but you have to look hard to find someone. We ordered tea and they could not find a lid for a teapot, they used foil. There are a few reasonably priced "dry" cafe's nearby but if you require alcohol use the Ramada Continental a 2 minute walk away. For eating and drinking consider taking a cab to Century Village, there are an excellent selection of bars and restaurants, better value than the 5 star hotel area. I recommend the St Tropez. This hotel is convenient for the airport. If you can get it for a reasonable price, for one night, it is worth considering. The problem for me was that my tour company, Cruiseclubuk sold it to me as a Superior 4 star holiday hotel. Check my other reviews and you will see that I rarely complain. However Cruiseclubuk are quite the worst tour company I have ever used. If you are tempted to use them, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Angel84India
Reviews.Content: stayed here only for one night in their special family suite. it was a 2 bedroom service apartment and the stay was very comfortable for someone who has been travelling across dubai all day. the rooms were spacious and well equipped, i had a fully equipped kitchen and the staff was courteous. they were providing a pick up and drop facility to the airport which was convenient. the breakfast was not included with the room rent but they did have a decent spread on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Dennis07
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in a good location if wanting an apartment close to the airport. There are also many good places to eat in the area and you can walk to the beach. It is some distance from the metro and the larger malls. The place is difficult to find as you have to enter a covered driveway to get to the front door.. I don't know what the challenges are in running the apartments but everyday we had to ask for a second bath towel. The apartment lacked basic kitchen supplies and the stove was dirty. The fridge was pre-set at a low temperature so we couldn't use it. We wanted to iron a few items and we had to go through 3 irons before we found one that worked. The pool is on the top floor and worked well except the pool deck was dirty. When you walked with wet feet, your feet got dirty. The Concierge was very helpful to us and povided a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Large, fancy, but not clean”
Reviews.Author: PaulGNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We were relocated here from the Zagy Arabian Suites as that hotel was over booked or had maintenance issues. They also upgraded us to one of the larger suites. Location isn't the best. It is good if you want to be close the the airport, but not if you want to be close to town. On first impression the hotel suite was very large with 2 bedrooms, one with ensuite. There was also a large lounge with dining table, a kitchen and also a powder room near the front door. On the down side there were cracks appearing in the walls and ceiling. Lounge suite was very worn and alot of surfaces weren't very clean. Also plates and cutlery weren't very clean and there was no detergent to clean them with. Also about half of the inventory of the kitchen was missing. This included the jug, but I was able to phone the reception to ask for one and with 10 minutes they had got one for us. In summing up they have a cleanliness problem and are quite a distance from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome service”
Reviews.Author: iceman2011
Reviews.Content: I had looked at one review that was posted on Tripadvisor so was skeptical at first. The email correspondance was great when i was emailing them from the US especially from Hadi ( Asist. Manager at ALmanar). After getting the great deal through Orbirz i was ready to go. We arrived at the Chelsea tower in Dubai through the Eithad bus and the hotel bus was there to pick us up within 5 minutes. We were a group of 5 tired adults with 10 large luggage bags which they took care of which was nice. The ride was about 15 minutes through downtown to get us to the hotel. The hotel is located in Diera which is the middle of Dubai and Sharjah, good location if you ask me. They were resturants, bank, hospital, laundry place, internet cafe within a 2 minute walk from the hotel which was great. Once we got to the hotel, our bags were taken care of as we walked in to get our rooms assigned. we had reserved 2 single bed rooms for five adults, but were upgraded to a one 2 bedroom and another one bedroom close to each other which we wanted. The hotel is nice and very clean with a resturant inside the hotel as well. We didnt eat there since the prices were very expensive compared to outside even the drinks in the fridge was expensive. Both are rooms were very impressive. Large size rooms with a seperate full size kitchen and two full bathrooms in each room. The rooms were very well kept. They had enough towels as well as hair dryers, iron w/board available. We have the tub clog on us once but they were quick to fix it.They have internet service in the lobby for 25 dirhams an hour but its really slow so i think even the wireless service they provide would be slow. The walls must have been concrete since we could not hear anyone next door from either room. Hadi was exceptional for helping us figure out what time the return pickup was from the chelsea tower. There is one asian lady which was not so helpful and had a frown whenever we saw her. Our stay was very comfortable for the 3 days we were there and i would certainly recommened ABC Almanar.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay--> Hotel has bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: auxkoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and we were bitten all over bodies by the bed bugs in the mattress. They changed the room and same thing happen in the second room. We talk to other guest at the hotel and they had the same problem. The entire hotel has bed bugs. Do not stay, unless you want to be a victim of the bed bugs. There are many problems with this hotel: 1) They are very far from tourist attractions. Every time you want to go somewhere, you have to pay a lot of taxi money to get to places and when you want to come back to the hotel, the taxi driver don’t know the hotel or the address. Even when you show them the actual address of the hotel, they don’t know where it is and they get lost going back to the hotel and you end up paying the high taxi far. The hotel does not offer any transportation services and when they feel like driving you somewhere with their van, the want a lot of money. Like we paid them $100 the first day, to take us to the shopping mall and we found later that the yellow taxi in the street was only $40. 2) There front desk customer service is horrible. I don’t know who made this hotel a four star hotel, they are horrible and they should have no star. When you arrive, they tell you that their door key is not working and that every time you want your door open, you have to stop by the front desk. You could only have one towel per person per day. If you call the front desk and ask for a towel, they tell you that you cannot have more than one towel per day. There wireless internet service doesn’t work and if you want to use their hotel lobby computer, is $25 per hour. That’s just a rip off. They having construction in their hotel, so be ready to wake up from the sound at 7 am. So, over all the hotel is terrible and on top of that, they have bed bugs, so don’t waste your money on this hotel. I have included the bed bugs bites picture, so you could see what happen to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall service & clean Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: roodey
Reviews.Content: Just came back after a week at this hotel. The Al Manar hotel apartments (part of ABC group) is located a 10 minute drive from Dubai international Airport which will cost around 40 dirhams by taxi which is £7.00. We had a very big room including a kitchen area that consists of frige freezer, washing machine, microwave, toaster, kettle and electric hob. You also get some basic cuttlery and the fridge has a mini bar (Non Alcoholic drinks only). It also has a secure safe, nice table and chairs, ironing board/ iron and the all important flat screen TV. The hotel is a ten minute taxi drive to the Al mamzar beach park costs around 14 dirhams £2.50 entry fee to the park is five dirhams £0.90p. There is a pool area, place to eat, male/female changing area and a lovely beach. The gold and spice souk/market are not far away if you like that kind of thing. I would recommend going to the Wild Wadi Water park great fun for adults and kids and you can get some great pictures of the Burj Al Arab. We went bed and breakfast. The breakfast is not the best i've had on holiday however its not the worst. The only other downside is there are no fantastic views from your room as there is a construction site next door however we hardly noticed it as we spent most of the day sight seeing. Noise you cannot notice as all windows are fully double glazed. The staff are quite friendly and always willing to help. There is a small pool on the rooftop with sun loungers a shower area and toilets for that all important tan! Location wise its ok, however if you decide to travel to the Jumeirah end it will cost by taxi around 60 dirhams £10 each way and more if you venture futher afield. There is now the partially completed dubai metro(un manned automatic train Like the DLR in London) which you you can get around town with running from Jebal Ali to Rashidya called the red line started 7 weeks ago. However from the hotel you need to get a taxi to Deira city centre station 10 mins away. Its very modern and very clean with the average single trip costing 4/5 dirhams less than £1.00. You can buy a silver card for 6 dirhams and top it up as you go. (A bit like an oyster card on the London underground but way cheaper ! The green line will be completed by mid 2010. The only other thing is that you must get into the right compartment as there is a women and children only carriage the others are mixed. Perfect if you want to go to the emirates mall. There are a good few places to eat nearby the hotel serving western and indian food. I quite enjoyed the iranian chicken sandwich made in fresh bread from accross the road. Drinks are very cheap too stock up as you will need it due to the heat ! I would recommend this hotel to anyone on an average budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms construction next door”
Reviews.Author: Geminidreams
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and modern. Had reasonable size bedroom large tv, kitchen, big fridge so of for extended stay. There was construction of building next door and noise was an issue but it stopped at nightfall. Dont like these Dubai hotels wanting to hold passports. I have stayed at 2 4 points and they scanned passports and returned them in 5 min so I dont understand why others take hours and complain when you ask for them back right qaway. Dont really know about the location. It was opposite direction to central hotels I normally stay at and probably 15 - 20 min from main terminals. I stayed as a Dubai stopover as I had a long connection and my wife needed visa so ended up here. Good point was the free shuttle to the airport.

HotelInfo.Name: AlManar Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: 24th Hor Al Anz East, Dubai POB 62495, United Arab Emirates
